result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. Pagel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Complete domestic abuse counseling. Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. Pagel

records.addlTxt: to defendant re: payment of atty fees
Restitution Order in the total amount of $1,345.16
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Filed by Atty Roger Klopp
Filed By Atty Karl Green

2:08 PM Cases called: 21CF641, 21CM350, and 22CF370. Defendant Matthew J. Pagel in court.  Attorney Karl A Green in court for Matthew J. Pagel.  Attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 21CM350, count 3 of 21CF641, and to count 3 of 22CF370. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. All remaining charges were dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 2 years each count, conditions of probation include: $543.00 costs each count, Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Complete domestic abuse counseling, and restitution in each case. Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs. 1 day credit in 22CF370 and 21CM350, and 2 days of credit in 21CF641. Must report to Probation by noon on 9-30-22.  2:29 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
